C3 networks are fragile and are vulnerable to jamming. ECM effects jam C3 effects within {0} meters when activated, preventing any unit in the area from being part of any C3 networks.
C3 networks are inherently fragile, causing the networks to be disabled when in the range of any ECM source, friendly or enemy.
C3 Network Slave Unit - Connects unit to a C3 network, allowing it to share sensor data with other C3-equipped units.
C3 Network Master Unit - Connects unit to a C3 network, allowing it to share sensor data with other C3-equipped units
C3 Networks provide all C3-equipped units with the best possible range accuracy to enemy targets based on the closest C3-equipped unit in the network to the target.
C3 Master provides all C3-equipped units within {0} meters with {1} resolve gain.
C3 Master provides all C3-equipped units within {0} meters with {1} evasion ignore on weapon attacks.
C3i networks, unlike C3 networks, are hardened against ECM interference. C3i is not disabled when in range of an ECM source.
Improved C3 Network Unit - Connects unit to a C3i network, allowing it to share sensor data with other C3i-equipped units
C3i Networks provide all C3i-equipped units with the best possible range accuracy to enemy targets based on the closest C3i-equipped unit in the network to the target.
C3i provides all C3i-equipped units within {0} meters with {1} resolve gain.
C3i provides all C3i-equipped units within {0} meters with {1} accuracy on weapon attacks.
Drone Networks provide all drone-equipped units with the best possible range accuracy to enemy targets based on the closest drone-equipped unit in the network to the target.
Nova Combined Electronic Warfare System combines a C3 Network unit with Advanced ECM and Sensor Suites - Shares Sensor Information

Variable Range Missiles have variable damage modes that shift their range bands and increase damage and accuracy the further away the target is. The default mode for the VRM is medium range, which is reflected in the MechBay.
The Variable Range Missile close range band is below 300 meters, at which the VRM suffers an accuracy penalty and deals half damage.
The Variable Range Missile medium range band is between 300 and 600 meters, at which the VRM does standard damage with standard accuracy.
The Variable Range Missile long range band is between 600 and 1000 meters, at which the VRM does 50% more damage and has an accuracy bonus.
Elec-Lasers scramble the target's systems for {0} accuracy.
Double Barrel Autocannons fire a pair of shells at once with no risk of jamming.
Mass Drivers are heavy and bulky but also come with electronic restrictions on their mis-use, which prevents mounting more than 1 on a unit at any time.
The NPC scrambles the target's systems for {0} accuracy. This effect stacks with itself up to {1} times.

Settings.Long: DRM Movement Debuff, {0} move speed, stack {1} times
Settings.Full: DRMs inflict a {0} movement penalty, which stacks up to {1} times with itself.

Settings.Long: DRM Heat Debuff, {0} heat gen penalty, stack {1} times
Settings.Full: DRMs inflict a {0} heat generation penalty, which stacks up to {1} times with itself.
Modal Lasers have 4 fire modes and let the user dial between them as desired.
Modal Lasers base mode is a balance between accuracy, damage, and range. The base mode has standard laser accuracy bonuses.
Modal Lasers damage mode increases the damage per trigger pull at the cost of generating much more heat and being less accurate.
Modal Lasers accuracy mode increases the weapon's accuracy significantly but reduces the damage per trigger pull and increases the heat generated.
Modal Lasers range mode increases the weapon's range but reduced the damage per trigger pull and slightly decreases accuracy.
Alternative Payload Missiles have very poor base damage but are capable of firing many munition types. They also are very resistant to AMS and are good at securing critical damage.
The Directed X-Ray Cannon, in addition to dealing respectable heat damage, also inflicts a lingering heat penalty that afflicts the target with extra heat during their next activation.
The Double-Barrel Autocannon has two firing modes. In base mode, it does high damage but no stability damage. In stability mode, it does high stability damage but no regular damage.
In stability mode, this DBAC deals {0} stability damage per shell while dealing 0 regular damage.

The Sanctuary Drone Interface replaces a human in the cockpit with a remote-controlled drone. This insulates the pilot against feedback injuries while providing numerous benefits. However, it is not fool-proof. If the drone is destroyed, such as through cockpit destruction, lethal feedback can occur to the pilot controlling it from afar.
Cannons are primitive ballistic weapons that expend their entire ammo reseve in a single burst, much like Rocket Launchers do.
This cannon fires {0} shots when used.
Grenade launchers are simple weapons that fire a single grenade shell in an arc at a target. Grenades often carry various payload types.
Grenade Ammo - {0} Shots
Each shot from the AMS does {0} damage to incoming missile health.
Each missile in this launcher's flight has {0} health.
Each missile in this launcher's LRM flight has {0} health.
Each missile in this launcher's SRM flight has {0} health.
Each missile in this launcher's ATM flight has {0} health.
On overload, the AMS will fire multiple times a turn instead of only once.
This is a placeholder item representing a c-bill loan to the player's company. It cannot be equipped to or used by mechs in any way. To pay back the loan, sell this item in a store.

This ECM stacks with other sources instead of overriding them.
This equipment provides the carrying unit with immunity to sensor locks.
This equipment is depreciated and will not function. Remove it from your mechs and sell it at first opportunity.
Variable MRMs have 4 fire modes and let the user dial between them as desired.
Variable MRM's base mode is the same as a standard MRM: a balance between accuracy, heat, and damage. The base mode has the same accuracy penalty as normal MRMs.
Variable MRM's damage mode increases the damage per missile at the cost of generating much more heat and being even less accurate.
Variable MRM's accuracy mode increases the weapon's accuracy significantly but reduces the damage per missile and increases the heat generated.
Variable MRM's heat mode decreases the heat generated by firing the system but also decreases the accuracy and damage dealt.
The ATS provides allies in a 150 meter radius with {0} on their attacks while the ATS is active.
The ATS provides the carrying unit with a {0} on its attacks while the ATS is active.
The Stealth Field has a radius of {0} meters around the carrying unit.
The Stealth Field makes it {0} harder for enemies to spot this unit either on sensor or directly.

Avionics equipment allows the carrying unit to transform between BattleMech and AirMech mode. In AirMech mode the unit gains heavily increased movement speed but is more susceptible to both regular damage and stability damage and is not affected by terrain in any way.
When in AirMech mode, this unit takes {0} more damage.
When in AirMech mode, this unit suffers {0} to accuracy.
When in AirMech mode, this unit's stability threshold is lowered by {0}.
When in AirMech mode, this unit moves {0} faster when walking.
When in AirMech mode, this unit's sprinting modifier is increased by {0}.
This weapon has multiple fire modes, each of which may have their own unique behaviors. This weapon's first alternate mode is {0}.
This weapon has multiple fire modes, each of which may have their own unique behaviors. This weapon's second alternate mode is {0}.
This weapon has multiple fire modes, each of which may have their own unique behaviors. This weapon's third alternate mode is {0}.
This weapon has multiple fire modes, each of which may have their own unique behaviors. This weapon's fourth alternate mode is {0}.
This piece of equipment gives the carrying mech perfect 360 degree firing arcs.
This piece of equipment prevents pilots from bleeding out from their injuries.
The Super MML shoots any and all ammo variants for the following weapon types: LRM, SRM, Streak SRM, MRM, ATM, Thunderbolt 20, and ArrowIV.
Provides {0} Evasion pips ignored
{0} Evasion Ignored with Ballistic weapons
{0} Evasion Ignored with Energy weapons
{0} Evasion Ignored with Missile weapons
Increases the clustering modifier of this weapon by {0}, meaning missiles are that much more likely to hit the same location on the target.

Settings.Long: Ostscout Targeting provides {0} accuracy within 150 meters.
Settings.Full: The Ostscout's targeting systems are so good that they provide {0} accuracy against enemies within a 150 meter radius of the Ostscout.
The target of this equipment takes {0} more damage from incoming missile fire.
Internal combustion engines are weak and slow, equating to a {0} movement penalty.

Fuel cell engines cannot be equipped with advanced heat sinks. Fuel cells cannot make use of any heat sink systems other than standard heat sinks. They also cannot use any e-cooling, heat bank, or heat exchanger equipment.

Settings.Long: Pilot risk from Fission Engine Damage
Settings.Full: Fission engines are vulnerable to incoming damage. When damaged, a fission engine spews hard radiation around itself. This overwhelms a 'Mech's internal life support systems and makes the pilot inside vulnerable to high heat situations, causing them to take a pilot injury when their 'Mech becomes overheated...

Fission engines cannot be equipped with advanced heat sinks. Fission engines cannot make use of any heat sink systems other than standard heat sinks. They also cannot use any e-cooling, heat bank, or heat exchanger equipment.

Internal combustion engines cannot be equipped with advanced heat sinks. Internal combustion engines cannot make use of any heat sink systems other than standard heat sinks. They also cannot use any e-cooling, heat bank, or heat exchanger equipment.
The Insanity PPC scrambles Target's systems for {0} Accuracy, but unlike other PPCs the Insanity PPC's debuff stacks with itself up to twice and also stacks with other PPC debuff effects normally.
The Insanity PPC fires a cluster of three shots, each doing significant armor, heat, and stability damage to both the main target and nearby enemies, as well as imparting a serious accuracy debuff.
This equipment increases the pilot's maximum resolve capacity by {0}.
This equipment permits the carrying unit to call in an airdropped unit of some kind. The airdropped unit is controlled by allied forces and will support you in combat as best it is able.
This equipment's airdropped unit is a drone. The default airdropped drone is a VTOL drone, but contracts can be purchased to allow other, more advanced, units to be dropped instead.
This equipment's airdropped unit is a mech. The default airdropped mech is an UrbanMech, but contracts can be purchased to allow other, more advanced, units to be dropped instead.
This equipment's airdropped unit is a tank. The default airdropped tank is a Vedette, but contracts can be purchased to allow other, more advanced, units to be dropped instead.
This equipment's airdropped unit is a turret. The default airdropped turret is a Standard Laser turret, but contracts can be purchased to allow other, more advanced, units to be dropped instead.

This equipment's airdropped unit is a squad of battle armor. The default airdropped squad is an Inner Sphere Standard BA squad, but contracts can be purchased to allow other, more advanced, units to be dropped instead.
This equipment allows for {0} airdrops of its specific type per deployment.
Airdrops from this equipment must happen within {0} meters of the unit calling in the airdrop.

This equipment permits the carrying unit to call in an aerospace strafing run on a designated flight path. Strafing units attack everything in the flight path, including allied units as they are unable to discriminat due to the speed of the strafe.
This equipment allows for {0} strafing runs per deployment.

Settings.Long: Number of Waves per Strafing Run
Settings.Full: Each strafing run called by this equipment has {0} waves in it.
This strafing run is {0} meters wide and targets all units, enemies and allies alike in the flight path.
This strafing run is at most {0} meters long and targets all enemies in the flight path.
Activating this ability costs the activating unit {0} resolve.
Activating this ability costs your mercenary unit {0} c-bills.
Calling in a strafing run costs your mercenary unit {0} c-bills per wave of the strafing run.
The Aerospace Fighter provided by this contract fields the following weapon as its main weaponry: {0}.
This component provides {0} heat dissipation to the carrying unit.
This component provides {0} bonus armor to the location this component is mounted in.
HarJel is a black jel substance that provides BattleMechs with slow but consistent self-repair in combat.
The HarJel Self-Repair System only protects locations that it is installed in.
The HarJel Self-Repair System repairs {0} armor in its installed location per turn.

Legend-Killer imbues its pilot with the spirit of its first and most famous owner, Grey Noton. Legend-Killer gains +40% damage and +3 accuracy with AC/5s and all kinds of Lasers. It also provides bonus resolve in combat, a higher resolve maximum in combat, and even +2 intiative. And to think, this is just a portion of Noton's skill.
This unit has a {0} bonus to targeting aerial units, such as VTOLs and LAMs.
This unit ignores {0} evasion on aerial units, such as VTOLs and LAMs.
This item provides {0} bonus c-bills to the company upon being acquired. It serves no other purpose.
Congrats! You found a box of goodies! What's inside, nobody actually knows! Might be something good in there! Grab it and find out!
The Gauss Capacitor increases Gauss weapon ranges by {0}%
The Gauss Capacitor increases Gauss weapon damage by {0}%
The Gauss Capacitor increases Gauss weapon generated heat by {0}%
ProtoMech Autocannon/8 Ammo - {0} Shots
ProtoMech Autocannon/4 Ammo - {0} Shots
ProtoMech Autocannon/2 Ammo - {0} Shots

This explosive pod deals area-of-effect damage to units in a small radius. Originally intended for infantry, it has been repurposed for general combat use. It is capable of damaging friendlies so care is required for its application.
This explosive pod deals damage specifically and exclusively to Battle Armor. It does not damage the carrying unit.
This explosive pod has a radius of {0} meters, centered on the carrying unit.
This explosive pod deals {0} standard damage, centered on but not damaging the carrying unit.
{0} meter radius for the Ambient Targeter's allied accuracy boost effect.
{0} meter radius for AMS coverage.

MagPulse munitions do little to no damage but instead inflict a {0} point accuracy penalty to the affected enemy. This penalty stacks up to {1} times and lasts until that unit finishes its next activation.
This piece of equipment permits the equipped unit to serve as a mount for Battle Armor squads.
This weapon deals {0} more damage to Battle Armor.
This equipment allows the Battle Armor to mount up on other units, such as Omnimechs, APCs, or any unit with BA Handholds. This does *not* permit the BA to make swarm attacks unless otherwise noted.
This equipment allows the Battle Armor to swarm attack other units, entering their space and attacking them directly while being difficult to shoot back.
This component has {0} linked slots attached to it. Destruction of any of them destroys the whole component.
This component provides a flat {0} Damage Reduction
This component provides a flat {0} Damage Reduction to Ballistic weapon damage.
This component provides a flat {0} Damage Reduction to Missile weapon damage.
This component provides a flat {0} Damage Reduction to Energy weapon damage.
Produces {0} heat per hex jumped.
Moves {0} hexes per Walk MP.
This jump jet can be fitted on a 'Mech no smaller than {0} tons.
This jump jet can be fitted on a 'Mech no larger than {0} tons.
This is a Freezer Heat Sink, which has better performance than true Double Heat Sinks but cannot be mounted with anything other than Standard Heat Sinks and cannot be engine-mounted at all.
3rd Generation Missile Launcher Ammo - {0} Shots

This is a Ground Mobile Hyperpulse Generator, a miniturized version of the basis of all interstellar communication technology. The Ground Mobile HPG is capable of emitting a pulse that forces mechs into shutdown automatically, though it is slow to charge.
The Ground Mobile HPG has a base chance to shut down its target of {0}, modified by the target's Guts skill.

This is a Mech Taser, a charged projectile weapon that pulses a huge quantity of electricity into its target in hopes of forcing a shutdown effect. The Mech Taser is fragile and prone to exploding when jostled however.
The Mech Taser has a base chance to shut down its target of {0}, modified by the target's Guts skill.
The Mech Taser impairs the target's movement speed, reducing it by {0}.
The Mech Taser scrambles the target's systems, reducing accuracy by {0}.

This component is a bin of armor repair components used for in-field armor repair. This component repairs armor at a rate of 1 point of armor for 1 point from the bin. It cannot repair armor on destroyed or missing locations and it can only repair armor up to {0} of the original total.
Armor Repair Components - {0} total armor points.

This component is a bin of SPAce Magic Modular by Yang. It permits the refilling of any ammunition using SPAMMY points. It uses SPAMMY points equal to the equivalent tonnage-per-shot of the ammo it is replacing (for example: an AC/20 round is 1/5th of an ammo bin so it costs 1/5th of the SPAMMY points in the SPAMMY bin to refill 1 AC/20 round).
SPAMMY Ammunition - {0} total SPAMMY points
This piece of gear is not used for any useful purpose in combat.
{0} Defense against being hit by missile weapons
This is a hybrid of Endo-Steel and Standard mech structure. It provides a limited amount of weight savings via fixed Hybrid Structure crits placed around the mech.
This is a piece of Hybrid Endo-Steel Standard Structure and provides {0} tons saved.
This piece of gear indicates this unit as an Aerospace unit. It ignores terrain, ignores all designmasks such as cover or fire, is unaffected by pathing restrictions, and ignores landmines.
This piece of equipment occupies {0} additional slots in a mech's critical locations.

This weapon, when fired, forces a check that, when failed, knocks down the firing unit automatically from the immense recoil effect. This check is resisted by a combination of the firing unit's Piloting skill and base tonnage (more is better in both cases).
The base self-knockdown chance on this weapon is {0}.
This piece of gear guarantees your pilot is safely recovered after an ejection, removing any chance for them to be captured and thus require a rescue mission.

This heatsink-like equipment is a Heat Controller. It functions similarly to Inner Sphere-spec Thermal Exchangers. However, unlike Exchangers, Heat Controllers can be stacked together for more effectiveness.
This heatsink-like equipment is a Heat Negator. It functions similarly to Inner Sphere-spec Heat Banks. However, unlike Heat Banks, Heat Negators can be stacked together for more effectiveness.
This is an industrial fluid sprayer, capable of firing several ammo types. It is not a militarized piece of gear and has an inherent accuracy penalty and very short range.
This is a militarized version of an industrial sprayer. The Fluid Gun is capable of firing multiple different ammo types but suffers from fairly short range which limits its applications somewhat.
Paint ammo changes the paintscheme of the attacked unit at random. Enjoy the pretty colors.

This is a bomb bay containing one bomb for use during combat. Bomb bays are very powerful weapons for their weight but only have one shot per bay and can only be used by aerial units such as VTOLs or LAMs.
This mech has a limited spread of Omni Hardpoints, restricted to the following locations only: {0}. All other hardpoints on this mech behave normally.

When using this jump jet type, a mech can mount a number of max jump jets equal to {0} times its Walk MP (i.e. if Walk MP is 4 and Max JJ Count is 1, the mech can mount 4 JJs; if Walk MP is 4 and Max JJ Count is 1.5, the mech can mount 6 JJs).
This equipment reduces incoming physical attack damage by {0}. This applies only to the direct melee damage itself, not the stability damage.
This equipment provides its carrier with immunity to fire weapons and effects in combat. They do not suffer any ill effects from being struck by fire weapons.

This is a Webb Targeting Computer. Webb TCs provide a variety of weapon attachments to the 'Mech when equipped. These attachments provide a modest accuracy bonus for any attached weapon and are compatible with any and all forms of weaponry.
This weapon is compatible with a weapon attachment, specifically: {0}.
This equipment is a weapon attachment. It can target the following weapon types: {0}.
This weapon attachment adds one or more new fire modes to the modified weapon. To use the attachment, be sure to use the new fire mode or modes.
This weapon attachment operates differently for different attached weapons and their different ammunitions. Its mechanical effects are described on the ammunition that it enables, specifically: {0}
This weapon attachment modifies the attached weapon's heat generation by {0}.
This weapon attachment modifies the attached weapon's damage generation by {0}.
This weapon attachment adds a {0} jam chance to the attached weapon.
This weapon attachment permits the attached weapon to ignore {0} evasion.
This weapon attachment adds a {0} accuracy bonus to the attached weapon.
This weapon attachment modifies the attached weapon's damage by {0} per missile.

This weapon attachment increases the attached weapon's number of shots per trigger pull by {0} in all modes (i.e. it increases each mode by its normal step of shots, so if the weapon on x1 fires 3 shots, it now fires +3 in each mode).
This weapon attachment gives the attached weapon the ability to fire twice, like an Ultra Autocannon does, with a jam chance of {0}.
This weapon attachment gives the attached Cannon the ability to accept external ammo from the same class of Rifle (i.e. the Light Cannon can accept Light Rifle ammo) but at a {0} damage penalty.
This weapon attachment gives the attached Rocket Launcher the ability to accept external ammo from Medium Range Missiles but at a {0} damage penalty and a {1} accuracy penalty.
This weapon attachment gives the attached Gyrojet launcher the ability to accept external ammo from Long Range Missiles but at a {0} damage penalty and a {1} accuracy penalty.
This weapon attachment gives the attached weapon the ability to accept external {0} ammo.
This piece of equipment is incompatible with Quad Mechs and cannot be used with them.
Reduces pilot bleed out speed by {0}.
This component modifies the pilot's Guts Skill by {0}.
This component modifies the pilot's Gunnery Skill by {0}.
This component modifies the pilot's Piloting Skill by {0}.
This component modifies the pilot's Tactics Skill by {0}.
This component is immune to damage and cannot be destroyed through normal combat.
